Summary I've been lucky enough to have spent the majority of my career working in all areas of marketing, with experience in both B2C and B2B marketing, including creative development, media strategy, event marketing, CRM, brand research, product marketing and digital.  
 
Having spent nearly a decade doing marketing for BMW of North America, I decided I was ready for a change, and wanted to drink more heavily from the digital fire-hose. Most recently I lead a team focused on modern brand building. In this role, I'm responsible for defining how Google and YouTube are positioned to Fortune 500 brands as well as Google’s brand thought leadership. 
 
With all the changes in consumer behavior and the trends toward constant connectivity, there's never been a more exciting time to be in marketing. I'm excited to be a part of it.

- Held "Google Mobile Day" - the first Android thought-leadership event in Russia for 200 C-level executives, top journalists & tech bloggers. https://goo.gl/CsIyEf 
 
- Launched large-scale advertising campaign for Navigation in Moscow & St.Petersburg (TV & cinema ads, radio, online, PR event) https://goo.gl/tfIVjw 
 
- Launched Google Transit in 11 Russian cities supported by targeted online ad campaigns. 
 
- Conducted and published in-depth research "Mobile Internet in Russia" in partnership with Json & Partners. http://goo.gl/FQCu6c 
 
- Managed the creative approval process for all co-marketing partner creatives that featured Google Mobile Services or Android Brand in Russia (including 10 TV campaigns). Summary Business professional with a varied skill set across marketing and sales. Proven track record of excelling in a fast-paced and results-oriented environment, coupled with the ability to jump seamlessly between analytical/creative marketing responsibilities and consultative sales functions. Passion for creating positive in the world through my talents, energy, and work ethic. 
 
Past: Cut my teeth from 2010 to 2013 on search, display, and video executions for Google's biggest clients - most notably in the spaces of e-commerce and omni-channel retailing. Moved to London in 2013 to work on Finance brands as they figured out branded video content on YouTube.  
 
Present: Came back stateside and moved into the prestigious APMM program, learning the client side of the business across creative, growth, and product. Focused on the launch and development of Google's gTLD strings, as well as the day-to-day management of the company's domain portfolio. Since then, I've become one of the first marketers on Google Domains, touching every aspect of the marketing mix for the new business. Moved to Google Maps marketing in April of 2015, managing all social channels as well as working on traditional product marketing.  
 
When I'm not @ the Googleplex, some consider me one of the country's most promising young magicians. I perform for an array of prestigious clients nationwide under my stage name of David Gerard. I write, direct, and produce a one-man show that has sold out for over 4 years straight in the Bay Area.
